result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan T. Scalice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
--To pay restitution of $70, payable to DOC for clothing, joint & several
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee , joint & several

--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges
--No DNA Sample or Surcharge ordered due to date of violation

--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment
--Maintain absolute sobriety 
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No contact with CBB (dob: 7/28/1996)
--No presence at or within a 1000 feet of CBB's residence, school or place of employment
--No contact with any child except as allowed per Agent
--No DNA Sample or Surcharge ordered due to date of violation

Court presents basis and grants expugement upon successful completion of probation 

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with attached victim restitution request form(s)

Case called at 10:38 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jordan T. Scalice in court with Attorney Kate Frigo. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment
--Maintain absolute sobriety 
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges
--To pay restitution of $70, payable to DOC for clothing, joint & several
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee, joint & several 
--No contact with CBB (dob: 7/28/1996)
--No presence at or within a 1000 feet of CBB's residence, school or place of employment
--No contact with any child except as allowed per Agent
No DNA Sample or Surcharge ordered due to date of violation

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Court presents basis and grants expugement upon successful completion of probation, Court finds society will not be harmed and the Defendant will benefit.
Recess: 11:02 am

Case called at 2:00 pm [sf]
Defendant Jordan T. Scalice in court with Attorney Kate Frigo. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews hearing is set on Defense Determination of sex offender registration.
ADA Hall agrees with the research that has been done by the defense.
Court agrees with the Defense's interpretation of the statute.
Attorney Frigo requests a plea and sentencing be scheduled.
Court reminds the defendant that the bond and it's conditions remain in effect.

recess: 2:04 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Plea/Sentencing Hearing: to be set

Case called at 11:09 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jordan T. Scalice in court with Attorney Kate Frigo on behalf of Attorney John H. Bradley. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Frigo requests that matter be set for joint motion and plea date
ADA Hall - agreed, will be motion to clarify the potential punishments in this matter
Court/Counsel discuss scheduling - Parties decide to hold plea at later date
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Frigo indicates that Defense will be filing motion paperwork by end of next week
Court reminds Mr. Scalice that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 11:13 am

NEXT: (1) Schedule Motion Hearing (301.45 motion) 1/7/16 at 2:00 pm - Send notices

Case called at 2:54pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Jordan T. Scalice in court with Attorney Frigo for Atty. John H. Bradley.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Statement as to case status presented by Atty. Frigo - including that a psychosexual evaulation is scheduled in early December. 
Counsel agree in their request to have the case continued for Status in the 3rd week of December. 
Case continued for Status on 12/18/15 at 11am. 
Bond continued. 
Recess 2:56pm. 

NEXT - Notices to be mailed. 
Status on 12/18/15 at 11am.

Case called at 2:09pm [mo]
Defendant, Jordan Scalice does NOT appear in court. 
Attorney Kate Frigo appears on behalf of John H. Bradley in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Frigo indicates that she expected Mr. Scalice to appear today, she has had frequent and recent communication with Mr. Scalice.
ADA Hall indicates that Mr. Scalice is scheduled to undergo a Psychosexual Evaluation; requests an additional status conference.
The Court schedules a Status Conference in early November to ensure Mr. Scalice is maintaining attention to his case, Counsel can request an additional status thereafter to allow time to review the Psychosexual Evaluation. 
recess: 2:14pm

NEXT: Status Conference on 11/10/15 at 2:30pm

Attorney Dean Strange on behalf of Attorney John H. Bradley in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No contact with CBB (dob: 7/28/1996)  
-Booking at JCSD no later than 10/2/15
-Defendant to sign bond no later than 10/2/15
